txt.en:
'I have spent some time thinking about what Nár said and examining the map and his changes to it. I have come up with a theory by breaking down Nár's ramblings.

'In the eastern part of Thrór's Comb is a cave. The sea of gold speaks of the treasure the Draig-lûth is bringing there. Around the cave entrance you will often see drakes sunning during the day. I believe they are the teeth and scales he refers to. The fire must be part of an offering the clan makes to the dragons they worship.

'Head into the eastern hills of Thrór's Coomb and seek out this cave. If you find it, venture within and see if you find the weapons and armour you seek. If not, we can do nothing more for you. Be wary... I doubt the Draig-lûth will give up their treasures willingly.'
'If the cave is not there or is empty, we are at an impasse, and I doubt we will ever find where they are taking their treasures.'
Frithgeir believes that Nár's ramblings refer to a cave in the eastern hills of Thrór's Coomb. If he is correct, there should be a great cache of weapons and armour awaiting you there.
The cave entrance is believed to be in the eastern hills of Thrór's Coomb in Enedwaith.\n\nFrithgeir has translated Nár's ramblings and believes they refer to a drake-guarded cave.
